1.speaker: HANDA
1.japanese: {\an8}シロクマくん 今日はわざわざ 出てきてくれて ありがとう
1.english: Polar Bear. Thanks for meeting with me today.

2.speaker: POLAR BEAR
2.japanese: {\an8}雨で お店暇だから 平気
2.english: The café is slow today due to the rain, so it's no problem.

4.speaker: LESSER
4.japanese: こんにちは シロクマさん 半田さん
4.english: Hello, Mr. Polar Bear, Mr. Handa.

5.speaker: LESSER
5.japanese: ご注文が決まりましたら お呼びください
5.english: Let me know whenever you're ready to order.

6.speaker: HANDA
6.japanese: それでさ あの… 話っていうのは…
6.english: And so, I wanted to discuss...

7.speaker: PANDA
7.japanese: 笹子さん 何作ってるの？
7.english: What are you making, Miss Sasako? It's a prototype for a new cake.

8.speaker: PENGUIN
8.english: A roll cake? It's no ordinary roll cake.

9.speaker: SASAKO
9.japanese: パンダロールケーキで～す！
9.english: It's a panda roll cake! Panda-shaped foods are so enticing.

10.speaker: PANDA
10.japanese: そうでなくてもかわいいのに

11.speaker: PANDA
11.japanese: お口の中まで かわいくなっちゃって
11.english: but then the inside of your mouth becomes cute, too. What am I to do?

13.speaker: SASAKO
13.japanese: 冷蔵庫で少し冷やすから
13.english: I'm going to let it cool in the fridge,

16.speaker: PENGUIN
16.japanese: ああ 笹子さん カフェモカ おかわりね
16.english: Oh, could I get another café mocha, Miss Sasako?

20.speaker: PANDA
20.japanese: 今日は 雨で お客さん少ないし
20.english: There aren't many customers today because of the rain.

21.speaker: PANDA
21.japanese: 半田さん 今日来れば笹子さんと いっぱい話せるのにね
21.english: Mr. Handa could have talked to Miss Sasako a lot if he were here.

23.speaker: PENGUIN
23.japanese: 相変わらず間が悪いね
23.english: He has terrible luck, as usual.

24.speaker: PANDA
24.japanese: 動物園はお休みのはずなのに

25.japanese: なんで半田さん来ないの？
25.english: so I wonder why he isn't here.

27.speaker: PANDA
27.japanese: 僕が代わりに いろいろ聞き出してあげよう
27.english: I'll ask her a whole bunch of questions for him.

28.speaker: PENGUIN
28.japanese: キミ じっとしてることは できないのかな？
28.english: You just can't stay still, can you?

29.speaker: SASAKO
29.japanese: はい お待たせしました
29.english: There you go. Miss Sasako, you're bright and charming

30.speaker: PANDA
30.japanese: 飼育員の人とかに モテるんだろうね
30.english: so you're probably really popular with zookeepers. That's too direct!

31.speaker: SASAKO
31.japanese: いやだ パンダくん 何言ってんの

32.speaker: SASAKO
32.japanese: 私 背高いし 肩幅あるから
32.english: I'm tall and I have broad shoulders, so I'm always told I'm not feminine.

33.japanese: 誰かいたら 紹介してほしいくらい
33.english: If you know someone, I'd like you to introduce him. What?

34.speaker: PANDA
34.japanese: じゃあ 肩幅 何センチ？
34.english: Well, how broad are your shoulders?

35.speaker: PENGUIN
35.japanese: え… えっと 笹子さんの好みって どんな人かな？
35.english: U-Um, what kind of guys do you like, Miss Sasako? Huh?

36.speaker: SASAKO
36.japanese: 私より背が高くて 癒やし系の人かな
36.english: Someone who's taller than me and comforting. What?!

38.speaker: PANDA
38.english: W-What are we going to do?

39.speaker: GUY
39.japanese: 笹子さん 今日も来たよ
39.english: I've come by again today, Miss Sasako, since I look forward to having great coffee here on my days off.

40.speaker: SASAKO
40.japanese: ありがとうございます

41.speaker: GUY2(ew)
41.japanese: 笹子さん コーヒー おかわりちょうだい
41.english: Could I get another coffee, Miss Sasako? Coming right up.

42.speaker: GUY3
42.japanese: 笹子さん 今日のランチ 何かな？
42.english: What's the lunch special today, Miss Sasako?

43.speaker: SASAKO
43.japanese: メインは ベジミートの香味揚げですよ
43.english: Our main dish today issavory fried soy meat.

44.speaker: PANDA
44.japanese: お客さん かっこいい人 多くない？
44.english: Aren't there a lot of good looking customers?

45.speaker: PENGUIN
45.japanese: 半田さん ピンチだよ

46.speaker: HANDA
46.english: And so, I wanted to discuss... Yes?

47.speaker: HANDA
47.japanese: 笹子さん つきあってる人いるのかな？

50.speaker: POLAR BEAR
50.japanese: お昼まだなんだけど 食べていい？
50.english: I haven't had lunch yet. Mind if I eat something?

52.speaker: POLAR BEAR
52.japanese: この… １日５食限定のデラックスランチ
52.english: I'll have one of the deluxe lunches you only make five of per day.

53.speaker: HANDA
53.japanese: い… いちばん高いやつ！？
53.english: You're getting the most expensive thing?! U-Uh, go ahead...

54.speaker: LESSER
54.japanese: デラックスランチですね  かしこまりました
54.english: One deluxe lunch coming right up.

57.speaker: POLAR BEAR
57.japanese: このスープセットも頼みたかったんだけど
57.english: I wanted to order the soup set, too.

58.speaker: HANDA
58.japanese: レッサーくん スープセットも追加ね！
58.english: Could we add on a soup set, Lesser?

59.speaker: POLAR BEAR
59.japanese: 今は 彼氏いないみたいだよ 笹子さん
59.english: It looks like Miss Sasako doesn't have a boyfriend right now.

63.speaker: POLAR BEAR
63.japanese: 好みは背が高くて癒やし系の人だって
63.english: I heard she prefers someonetall and comforting.

64.speaker: HANDA
64.japanese: 俺… 笹子さんより ５センチ以上 低いかも
64.english: I think I'm at least five centimeters shorter than Miss Sasako...

65.speaker: POLAR BEAR
65.japanese: 大丈夫だよ シークレットブーツ履こう
65.english: Not to worry. Just wear these elevator boots.

66.speaker: HANDA
66.japanese: 急に背が伸びたら変でしょ…
66.english: It'd be strange if I grew suddenly, wouldn't it?

67.speaker: POLAR BEAR
67.japanese: じゃあ…笹子さんのほうを縮める？
67.english: Then... shall we make Miss Sasako shorter?

68.speaker: HANDA
68.japanese: シロクマくん 本気で考えてる？
68.english: Are you taking this seriously, Polar Bear?

70.speaker: POLAR BEAR
70.japanese: まぁ 笹子さんの好みは そう気にしなくていいよ
70.english: Well, I don't think you'll have to worry much about her preferences. Really?

71.speaker: POLAR BEAR
71.japanese: 例えば 僕の好みは アザラシだけど

72.speaker: POLAR BEAR
72.japanese: アザラシが捕まらなかったら セイウチも食べるし
72.english: But if I can't catch any seals, I'll eat walruses, too.

73.speaker: HANDA
73.japanese: シロクマくんのごはんと 一緒にしないでよ！
73.english: Don't compare this with your food preferences!

74.speaker: HANDA
74.japanese: 僕だってね 好きでセイウチ体型に 生まれたわけじゃないし
74.english: It's not like I wanted to be born shaped like a walrus. Oh? Walrus {\i1}(Seiuchi){\i0}?

76.speaker: HANDA
76.english: That would be the Seto region {\i1}(Seto Uchi){\i0}.

77.speaker: HANDA
77.english: That would be a log cabin {\i1}(ki no uchi){\i0}.

79.speaker: HANDA
79.english: That would be a surprise attack {\i1}(fuiuchi){\i0}.

80.speaker: HANDA
80.english: And this would be striking simultaneously {\i1}(aiuchi){\i0}.

81.speaker: HANDA
81.japanese: 悩んでるのに ひどい仕打ちだ！
81.english: This is really poor behavior towardssomeone who's really troubled {\i1}(shiuchi){\i0}. Well played.

82.speaker: POLAR BEAR
82.japanese: まぁ 仲よくなれる方法を 一緒に考えてあげるよ
82.english: Well, I'll help you think of a way to get closer to her. Really?

83.speaker: HANDA
83.japanese: いつも モテモテのシロクマくんに アドバイスもらえたら
83.english: I'll feel more confident after getting advice from you since you're so popular. I think...

85.speaker: POLAR BEAR
85.japanese: この店 スイーツも おいしいと思うよ
85.english: ...that the desserts here are delicious, too.

87.japanese: 好きなのなんでも頼んじゃって

89.speaker: GUY3
89.japanese: ヘルシーだし 味つけがいいね
89.english: It was healthy and the flavor was great.

90.speaker: SASAKO
90.japanese: ありがとうございます

91.speaker: GUY3
91.japanese: {\an8}あと レモンティーお願い
91.english: {\a6}Oh, could I get a lemon tea, too?

92.speaker: PENGUIN
92.japanese: {\an8}あと レモンティーお願い
92.english: Miss Sasako's getting even friendlier with the handsome guy.

95.speaker: HANDA
95.english: A text? I wonder who it's from.

96.speaker: HANDA
96.english: Oh, it's from Mr. Llama. If you ask me,

97.speaker: LLAMA
97.japanese: 静かに見続けるというのも1つの方法ではないかということです
97.english: continuing to admire her from afar isn't out of the question, either.

99.speaker: POLAR BEAR
99.japanese: アドバイス大募集中って みんなに回しといたから
99.english: I sent out a text to everyone asking for any advice. What?! E-Everyone?

101.speaker: LESSER
101.japanese: 清潔感と細やかな心遣いに勝ることはありません
101.english: Nothing can beat cleanliness and a heartfelt regard for others.

102.japanese: 半田さん ガンバです☆

104.speaker: PENGUIN
104.japanese: 半田さんは 間が悪いから それを逆に活かすべきだね
104.english: You have terrible luck, Mr. Handa, so you need to try to use that in your favor.

105.speaker: HANDA
105.japanese: 逆にって なんなのさ？
105.english: What do you mean, "use that in my favor"?

106.speaker: PANDA
106.japanese: 半田さんの バカァ～～～～っ！！
106.english: Mr. Handa, you idiot! What is this?! And what does he mean by "idiot"? From Miss Sasako, too?! I recommend the fried soy meat.

108.speaker: POLAR BEAR
108.japanese: ランチのアドバイスを お願いしといたよ
108.english: I asked her for a recommendation for lunch. What does that even mean?! Jeez, I even sent him a text.

109.speaker: PANDA
109.japanese: 半田さんたら まだ来ない

110.speaker: PANDA
110.japanese: 早くしないと 笹子さん 取られちゃうよ
110.english: If he doesn't hurry up, Miss Sasako's going to be taken. Panda!

112.speaker: PENGUIN
112.japanese: ロールケーキ！ロールケーキが そろそろ食べたいな～
112.english: The roll cake! I'd like to eat the roll cake right about now! Oh, really? Would you like some now?

113.speaker: SASAKO
113.english: Here you go. Oh my, Panda...

114.speaker: SASAKO
114.japanese: にらまないでよ そんなに 待ちかねてたの？
114.english: Please don't glare like that. Were you waiting that long? Mr. Handa...

117.speaker: PENGUIN
117.english: Is it because of Panda? Huh?

118.speaker: PANDA
118.japanese: キリッとしてて かっこいい
118.english: It looks so stern! How cool! Huh?!

120.speaker: POLAR BEAR
120.japanese: 半田さんは そのままが いちばんいいよ
120.english: I think you should stay just the way you are.

122.speaker: POLAR BEAR
122.japanese: それが 半田さんの良さだと思うよ

123.speaker: HANDA
123.english: Thank you. Come by the café again.

125.speaker: MAMA
125.japanese: 皆さん こんにちは

127.speaker: MAMA
127.japanese: 今日も家族のため スーパーへお買い物に来ました
127.english: I'm out buying groceries at the supermarket for my family.

128.speaker: MAMA
128.japanese: やっぱり 今夜も 竹と笹の 盛り合わせでいいかしらね
128.english: I think we'll have a combination platter of bamboo and bamboo grass again tonight.

129.speaker: MAMA
129.japanese: クルミの詰め放題だわ

130.speaker: MAMA
130.japanese: みんな大好きだから 買っていきましょう
130.english: Everyone loves them so I'll get some.

131.speaker: MAMA
131.english: This looks good. I got quite a few in.

132.speaker: S MAMA
132.japanese: あらあら パンダママじゃないの
132.english: Oh, if it isn't Panda Mama. Well, hello, Mama Red Squirrel.

133.speaker: S MAMA
133.japanese: あら～！ クルミの詰め放題じゃないの
133.english: Well if it isn't all you can stuff walnuts! Walnuts are our favorite!

134.speaker: MAMA
134.japanese: うちも家族が好きなので

135.speaker: S MAMA
135.japanese: やだ！ 何 その 気合の入ってない詰め方
135.english: Goodness, what's with this stuffing? There's no enthusiasm.

136.speaker: MAMA
136.japanese: そう？ だいぶ 入ったわよ
136.english: Really? I got quite a few in there. That wouldn't be considered all you can stuff!

137.speaker: S MAMA
137.japanese: パンダママったら おっとりしすぎ！

138.speaker: S MAMA
138.japanese: そんなんじゃ 資本主義社会を 生き抜いていけないわよ！
138.english: You won't be able to survive in this capitalist society like that!

139.speaker: MAMA
139.japanese: じゃあ どうすればいいのかしら？

140.speaker: S MAMA
140.japanese: もう… 詰め放題はね…
140.english: When you're dealing with all you can stuff,

141.speaker: S MAMA
141.japanese: まずは袋を伸ばすところからよ
141.english: you have to stretch out the bag first.

142.speaker: MAMA
142.japanese: まぁ それは知らなかったわ

143.speaker: S MAMA
143.japanese: 破れる寸前… 限界ぎりぎりまで伸ばす
143.english: You stretch it out as far as it'll go, just before it's about to rip.

144.speaker: S MAMA
144.japanese: 破れちゃ 元も子もないから 見極めが肝心よ
144.english: There's no point if it rips, so being extra careful is crucial. That looks about good.

145.speaker: S MAMA
145.japanese: さぁ 詰めていくわよ

147.speaker: S MAMA
147.japanese: あ～！ また ダメ ダメ！ そんな無頓着な詰め方
147.english: No, no, you're doing it wrong. You can't fill it so carelessly. What?

149.speaker: S MAMA
149.japanese: まず 壁面から攻めるの！

151.speaker: S MAMA
151.japanese: 緻密に計算して隙間を作らない
151.english: You carefully measure it out so you don't leave any gaps.

153.speaker: S MAMA
153.english: When you're dealing with all you can stuff,

154.speaker: S MAMA
154.japanese: たくさん詰めることで 得した気分になって
154.english: you feel special the more you can stuff.

155.speaker: S MAMA
155.japanese: 更に 詰め方の追求もできる
155.english: Then you can seek out even better methods of stuffing.

156.speaker: S MAMA
156.japanese: お買い物のエンターテインメントなのよ！
156.english: It's a true form of shopping entertainment!

157.speaker: MAMA
157.japanese: まぁ そうだったのね
157.english: Oh my! I had no idea.

158.speaker: MAMA
158.japanese: すごくたくさん入ったわ
158.english: I got quite a bit in there.

159.speaker: MAMA
159.japanese: あっ エゾリスママ ここに少し隙間があるみたいよ
159.english: Oh, Mama Red Squirrel. Looks like you have a slight gap there.

160.speaker: S MAMA
160.japanese: あら ホント！ 私としたことが ぬかったわ
160.english: Oh, you're right! I was completely off guard.

161.speaker: S MAMA
161.japanese: あなたも わかってきたようね パンダママ
161.english: Looks like you're starting to get it, as well, Panda Mama.

162.speaker: MAMA
162.japanese: でも もう パンパンだし
162.english: But it's filled to the brim.

163.english: I don't think we can fit any more.

164.speaker: S MAMA
164.japanese: 何言ってるの ここからが勝負よ！
164.english: What are you talking about? The battle starts here!

165.speaker: MAMA
165.japanese: エゾリスママ ごめんなさい
165.english: I'm so sorry, Mama Red Squirrel!

166.speaker: MAMA
166.japanese: 私が余計なことを言ったばかりに

167.speaker: S MAMA
167.japanese: 油断したわ おごりがあったのね
167.english: I let down my guard. I was too arrogant.

168.speaker: MAMA
168.japanese: 一緒に詰め直しましょ エゾリスママ
168.english: Let's stuff another bag together, Mama Red Squirrel.

169.speaker: S MAMA
169.japanese: おっとりし過ぎなんて 意地悪言ってごめんなさい
169.english: I'm sorry I said you were too gentle earlier.

170.speaker: MAMA
170.japanese: そんな… 私こそ勉強になったわ
170.english: Don't say that. I learned a valuable lesson. By the way, Mama Red Squirrel, want to go to an all-you-can-eat cake buffet afterwards?

171.speaker: MAMA
171.japanese: キングペンギンさんと約束してるのよ
171.english: I promised Ms. King Penguin I'd meet up with her. Oh, sounds wonderful!

172.speaker: S MAMA
172.japanese: どうも お世話さま

174.speaker: S MAMA
174.japanese: パンダママったら 何にも知らないんだもの
174.english: Panda Mama didn't know a thing.

176.speaker: KING
176.japanese: そういうことなら ケーキバイキングは
176.english: Well, you can call the all-you-can-eat cake buffet

177.speaker: KING
177.japanese: 悩む楽しさと食べるおいしさが 両方味わえる
177.english: the entertainment of sweets, since you can enjoy both the

178.japanese: スイーツのエンターテインメントと言えるわね
178.english: fun of contemplating and the deliciousness of eating. Oh, my! Everything looks so delicious! Pe-pen!

179.speaker: KING
179.japanese: まだ早いわ パンダママ
179.english: Not so fast, Panda Mama! What?

180.speaker: KING
180.japanese: ラインナップをひととおり確認したら 順位をつけるの
180.english: Once you've scoped out the lineup, you have to rank them.

181.speaker: KING
181.english: The ones you definitely want to eat.

182.speaker: KING
182.japanese: その次に食べたいもの
182.english: Then the ones you want to eat after that.

183.speaker: KING
183.japanese: お皿に取るのはそのあとよ
183.english: Only then, can you put things on your plate.

184.speaker: MAMA
184.japanese: なるほど よくわかったわ

185.speaker: MAMA
185.japanese: やっぱり いちばん食べたいのは イチゴのショートケーキ
185.english: The one I want to eat the most is the strawberry shortcake. Pe-pen!

186.speaker: KING
186.japanese: バイキングの基本は ２番目に 好きなものから食べるよ
186.english: The standard of an all-you-can-eat buffet is to eat your second favorite first.

188.speaker: S MAMA
188.japanese: 最初に いちばん好きなものを選ぶと余裕がなく
188.english: If you eat your favorite first, you'll rush

189.speaker: S MAMA
189.english: and you won't enjoy the flavor.

190.speaker: S MAMA
190.japanese: 好きなものじゃないと 味わう意味がない
190.english: There's no point in eating your favorite if you can't enjoy it.

191.speaker: KING
191.japanese: そのとおり エゾリスママ
191.english: Precisely, Mama Red Squirrel. The all-you-can-eat cake buffet tests your way of living.

192.speaker: S MAMA
192.japanese: ハードボイルドな戦場でもあるのよ

193.speaker: MAMA
193.english: B-Battlefield? Now we'll place the cake on our plates. The thing to remember here is not to overfill your plate.

194.speaker: KING
194.english: Just grab three or four. What? That's it?

196.japanese: お皿は ２回目にまた違うのを使うの
196.english: You use a different plate for your second round. But wouldn't that make the dishwasher's life harder?

199.speaker: MAMA
199.japanese: 一度に少しずつしか もらってこないと
199.english: It's a bit of a hassle having to go back and forth

200.speaker: MAMA
200.japanese: 何度も行ったり来たり大変ね
200.english: when you fill your plate with so little.

201.speaker: KING
201.japanese: それがいいんじゃないの
201.english: That's what's so great about it.

202.speaker: KING
202.japanese: 立ったり座ったり運動すれば
202.english: If you exercise by getting up and siting back down,

203.speaker: KING
203.japanese: そのぶんお腹が空くじゃない
203.english: you'll be able to make room for more.

205.speaker: MAMA
205.japanese: エゾリスママは お上品に食べるのね
205.english: You eat so elegantly, Mama Red Squirrel.

207.speaker: S MAMA
207.japanese: 両手で持たないとムリ
207.english: If I don't hold it with both hands, I can't eat it.

208.speaker: KING
208.japanese: 体型的に エゾリスには不利ね
208.english: I guess red squirrels' body size puts them at a disadvantage here.

209.speaker: MAMA
209.japanese: 頬袋に ためていけばいいんじゃない
209.english: Why not stuff your cheek pouches?

210.speaker: S MAMA
210.japanese: シマリス属やニホンザルと一緒にしないで！
210.english: Don't group me with chipmunks or Japanese monkeys!

211.speaker: S MAMA
211.japanese: エゾリスには そんなものないのよ！
211.english: Red squirrels don't have those! I-I'm sorry.

212.speaker: S MAMA
212.japanese: いいのよ 気にしてないわ

213.speaker: MAMA
213.japanese: キングペンギンさんも 食べ方 きれいよね
213.english: You eat quite delicately, too, Ms. King Penguin.

216.speaker: KING
216.japanese: まずは そっとくわえて…
216.english: First, you carefully hold it in your mouth,

217.speaker: KING
217.english: then bring it up... And gulp!

219.speaker: MAMA
219.japanese: 食べるところが 見えないくらいだわ
219.english: It's like we can't see you eating at all! You can gulp down a cake like its a drink. Pe-pen!

220.speaker: MAMA
220.japanese: なんなの ペッペーンって

221.speaker: KING
221.japanese: 紅茶やコーヒーは 別料金なのよ！

222.japanese: しかも ホテル価格

223.speaker: S MAMA
223.japanese: 税 サービス料 別
223.english: And they charge tax and a service fee!

224.speaker: S MAMA
224.japanese: よっぽどのことでないと 飲んじゃダメ！
224.english: Don't drink it unless it's an emergency!

225.speaker: KING
225.japanese: ノドが渇けば ケーキを飲めばいいのよ！
225.english: If you're thirsty, just gulp down some cake!

226.speaker: MAMA
226.japanese: でも 飲むのはいいけど
226.english: That's fine and all, but my palate is getting bored of all the sweets.

227.speaker: S MAMA
227.japanese: そういうときのために…軽食というジャンルが 用意されているのよ！
227.english: And for that very reason... They have light snacks ready for you, too.

229.japanese: ケーキバイキングと名乗るからにはお菓子を味わってこそ
229.english: Since it's an all-you-can-eat cake buffet, I thought it was just for eating sweets.

230.speaker: MAMA
230.japanese: 軽食なんて邪道だ なんて思ってたけど
230.english: I thought light snacks would be heresy.

232.speaker: KING
232.japanese: オールラウンドにケーキバイキングという空間を楽しんでこそ
232.english: Only once you've enjoyed all that an all-you-can-eat cake buffet has to offer,

233.speaker: KING
233.japanese: ケーキバイキンガー！ なのよ
233.english: can you be a true all-you-can-eat cake buffeter.

234.speaker: MAMA
234.japanese: お二人と 一緒に来られて よかったわ
234.english: I'm very thankful I came with you two.

235.speaker: MAMA
235.english: If I had come here alone, I'd—

237.speaker: MAMA
237.japanese: なんだか すごい達成感

238.speaker: KING
238.japanese: やったわね 私たち

239.speaker: S MAMA
239.english: I didn't think you were going to be able to finish that last plate, Panda Mama.

241.speaker: MAMA
241.japanese: 言わないで… 恥ずかしい

242.speaker: MAMA
242.japanese: あら？田中さんじゃない？
242.english: Oh, if it isn't Ms. Tanaka.

243.speaker: TANAKA
243.japanese: こんにちは パンダママ
243.english: Hello, Panda Mama. Are you out running errands?

244.speaker: MAMA
244.japanese: それがね 田中さん 聞いてくれる？ 大充実の一日
244.english: Well, you see, Ms. Tanaka, listen to this, I had a completely productive day. My last plate was so full!

246.speaker: MAMA
246.japanese: よかったら お茶でもしない？
246.english: Would you care to join us for some tea?

247.speaker: KING
247.japanese: いいわね 休みたいわ ちょっと 食べ疲れしちゃったから
247.english: That sounds great. I'd like to rest. I'm exhausted from all the eating.

248.speaker: MAMA
248.japanese: そういえば ここね 息子が常連なのよ
248.english: By the way, my son's a regular here.

249.speaker: KING
249.japanese: あっ 息子さん バイトは続いてるの？
249.english: Is your son still working the part-time job?

251.speaker: TANAKA
251.japanese: いつも 会ったら挨拶してくれるわよ
251.english: He always says hello when I see him.

252.speaker: MAMA
252.japanese: 愛想だけはいいのよ でも将来が心配
252.english: His courtesies may be his only good trait. But I'm so worried about his future.

253.speaker: KING
253.japanese: 家の子も カードっていうの？
253.english: My son is playing with, what are they called, cards?

254.speaker: KING
254.japanese: それで遊んでばっかりいるから 心配なのよ
254.english: He's been playing with them so much that I'm worried. Seems like everyone's in the same boat.

255.speaker: S MAMA
255.japanese: おかわりちょうだい 同じもの
255.english: Oh, could I get another of the same?

256.speaker: POLAR BEAR
256.english: Yes, ma'am. Refills are half price. Oh, my!

258.speaker: ALL
258.japanese: おかわりなのに お金とるの！？
258.english: It's a refill and you're charging us money?

259.speaker: TANAKA
259.english: It's like a café in a hotel!

260.speaker: POLAR BEAR
260.japanese: も… 申し訳ありません

261.speaker: S MAMA
261.english: Isn't half price a bit expensive?

262.speaker: KING
262.japanese: 時々 来てるんだから サービスしなさいよ
262.english: We come here every now and then so it should be on the house!

264.speaker: S MAMA
264.japanese: ホント ゆとりって怖いわ
264.english: You can't ever let your guard down.

265.speaker: TANAKA
265.japanese: あら もう こんな時間？
265.english: Oh, where did the time go?

267.speaker: POLAR BEAR
267.japanese: ありがとうございました

268.speaker: KING
268.japanese: ねぇ 今度は ランチバイキングに行きましょうよ
268.english: Say, let's go to an all-you-can-eat lunch buffet next time.

269.speaker: S MAMA
269.english: Sounds great! Where should we go?

270.speaker: MAMA
270.japanese: ちょっと 場所 教えてくれる？
270.english: Sounds like you know a good place. I do!

271.speaker: KING
271.japanese: １丁目に イタリアンレストランがあるでしょ
271.english: You know the Italian restaurant on 1st street, right?

272.speaker: KING
272.japanese: そこの評判がいいみたい
272.english: I've heard great things about that place!

274.speaker: S MAMA
274.japanese: あら ぜひ ご一緒したいわ

275.speaker: MAMA
275.japanese: コーヒー おかわりいただこうかしら
275.english: Could I get a refill on my coffee?

276.speaker: KING
276.japanese: おかわりの おかわりだから ４分の１のお値段でいいわよね？
276.english: It's a refill of a refill, so it'll only be a fourth of the price, right?

277.speaker: S MAMA
277.english: Makes perfect sense to me. I'd like a refill, too, Mr. Polar Bear.

278.speaker: KING
278.japanese: ああ 私も 半額の半額のおかわり もらえる？
278.english: Oh, me, too. Could I get half price on a half price refill?

279.speaker: POLAR BEAR
279.english: {\a6}Actually, a refill on a refill will not make it a lesser price...

282.speaker: PENGUIN
282.japanese: というか なんで僕まで？
282.english: Or rather, why do I have to hide with you? {\a6}What?!

283.speaker: PANDA
283.japanese: ペンギンさん ペンギンさん

285.speaker: PANDA
285.japanese: 旅に出ると気持ちが盛り上がるね
285.english: Isn't it exciting when we go on trips?

287.speaker: PANDA
287.japanese: ペンギンさん 盛り上がったまま全財産窓から投げちゃえば
287.english: Well since you're so excited, why don't you throw your life savings out the window?

288.speaker: PENGUIN
288.japanese: 窓開かんないし それにそこまでは盛り上がってないかな
288.english: The windows won't open, not to mention I'm not {\i1}that{\i0} excited.

289.speaker: PANDA
289.japanese: じゃペンギンさんちょっと黙っててよ 僕ねるから
289.english: Then could you shut up for a while, Mr. Penguin? I'm gonna go to sleep.

290.speaker: PENGUIN
290.japanese: 君がかけてきたんだけど
290.english: You're the one that started talking to me... Next week's Polar Bear Café,

291.speaker: POLAR BEAR
291.japanese: ペーパークラフトでお送りします
291.english: will be presented to you in paper craft.
